momMetaData.momTitle: Managed Object Model for Data Record Management function

structMember.name: cleartext
structMember.description: Indicates whether or not the password is entered in cleartext.

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Holds the password or passphrase text.

enum.name: FixedFileRecordsFlag
enum.description: This enum is used for the attribute 'fixedFileRecordsFlag'.

enumMember.name: VARIABLE
enumMember.description: Length of a file record is variable.

enumMember.name: FIXED
enumMember.description: Length of a file record is fixed.

enum.name: AlarmSeverity
enum.description: Defines the set of possible alarm severities for an AXE alarm.

enum.name: LengthType
enum.description: Specifies the range for files length.

enumMember.name: VARIABLE
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is variable. The length of a block is adjusted so that no unused bytes are included.

enumMember.name: FIXED
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is fixed. Bytes not occupied by are filled with the character specified by paddingChar attribute.

enumMember.name: EVEN
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is variable with even number of bytes. The length is made even, if needed, by addition of a padding character specified by paddingChar attribute.

enum.name: CdrCounterFlag
enum.description: Specifies the range for CDR counting function.

derivedDataType.name: NumberOfFiles
derivedDataType.description: Specifies range for number of files.

derivedDataType.name: FileHoldTime
derivedDataType.description: Specifies hold time range for file based transfer.

derivedDataType.name: BlockHoldTime
derivedDataType.description: Specifies hold time range for block based transfer.

derivedDataType.name: NumberOfRecords
derivedDataType.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'numberOfRecords'

derivedDataType.name: EcimEmpty
derivedDataType.description: Represents a leaf that has no value, it conveys information by its presence or absence.

class.name: DataRecordM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Data Record Management function. This function can be mainly segregated into the below parts: - Transfer of record data originating from CP towards message stores in the form of message records. - Transfer of message records from message stores in the form of either files or blocks. - Send the files or blocks to remote destination using TQs.

attribute.name: dataRecordMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: BlockBasedJob
class.description:
Represents a block based record transfer job. This job facilitates in the transfer of charging data records from the message stores to the remote server in the form of volatile buffers. Unlike the file based charging transfer which stores the record transfer files onto disk, block based charging transfer does not store anything on disk. The attributes of this class help in configuring the block record transfer towards remote server. Transfer of these blocks to a remote system is achieved with the help of the Data Transfer Management function.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Unset mandatory attribute(s): This message appears when the attribute 'transferQueue' is not provided during block based job creation. - Transfer queue not defined: This message appears when the transfer queue name entered is not defined. - Job already defined: This message appears when an attempt is made to define a job under a message store which already has a job (file or block) created. - No access to Data Transfer Functionality: This message appears when there is no access to the data transfer functionality. - Message Store buffer larger than block size : This message appears when length attribute value is smaller than the value of recordSize attribute of MessageStore MO class.

attribute.name: blockBasedJobId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: The TQ name used for transferring record data to a remote destination.

attribute.name: holdTime
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds a call record block is held before closing it.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum length of a call record block.

attribute.name: lengthType
attribute.description: Specifies whether the block length is fixed, variable or variable with even number of bytes.

attribute.name: paddingChar
attribute.description: The decimal value of a character used to fill unused bytes. Such unused bytes are filled in a fixed length call record block or in a call record block with a variable length but with a required even number of bytes.

class.name: FileBasedJob
class.description:
Represents a file based record transfer job. This job facilitates in the transfer of charging data records from the message stores to the remote server in the form of files. In this kind of transfer, the record transfer files are stored on disk. Each file consists of the message records which are retrieved from message stores. Each file is built with the received message records, before it is stored on data disk. The attributes of this class help in configuring the record transfer flow towards the remote server. Transfer of these files to a remote system is achieved with the help of data transfer functionality.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Unset mandatory attribute(s): This message appears when the attribute 'transferQueue' is not provided during file based job creation. - Transfer queue not defined: This message appears when the transfer queue name entered is not defined. - Job already defined: This message appears when an attempt is made to define a job under a message store which already has a job (file or block) created. - No access to Data Transfer Functionality: This message appears when there is no access to the data transfer functionality. - Message Store buffer larger than fixed record size: This message appears in case of attribute fixedFileRecordsFlag is set to FIXED and value of the recordLength attribute is smaller than the value of recordSize attribute of MessageStore MO class.

action.name: endCurrentDataFile
action.description:
Ends the record transfer file which is under construction and send it to remote destination immediately.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No data file to end: No data files are under construction in the specified FilebasedJob.

attribute.name: fileBasedJobId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: The TQ name used for transferring record files to a remote destination.

attribute.name: cdrCounterFlag
attribute.description:
Specifies whether CDR counting function is enabled or disabled. If enabled, it is possible to inform the remote system about the number of CDRs stored in a file. This information is appended to the file name.
Note: The CDR counting function is enabled only if the user is updated to send CDR number to APG.

attribute.name: holdTime
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum time, a file is held before closing it. Time is expressed in seconds. If the maximum filehold time is reached and no Call Data Records are received during the time interval, a file containing no data is created.

attribute.name: paddingChar
attribute.description: The decimal value of a character is used to fill the unused bytes in a fixed file record.

attribute.name: recordlength
attribute.description: Specifies the fixed length of an individual record. This value is expessed in bytes.

attribute.name: fileSize
attribute.description: Specifies the range of the file size. This value is expressed in kilobytes.

attribute.name: fixedFileRecordsFlag
attribute.description: Specifies that the components of a file records will have a fixed length or variable length.

attribute.name: minFileSize
attribute.description: Specifies the minimum size of a record transfer file expressed in bytes. The minimum file size functionality will be enabled if the value is non-zero.

attribute.name: hashKey
attribute.description: A 32 bit hexadecimal string given as an input in the form of key to the hash function. If the key is defined, then a 16 byte long hash is stored at the end of record transfer file. The hash value is generated from the content of the record transfer file.

class.name: StatisticsInfo
class.description: Represents the information about the current record transfer job statistics. For each record transfer job there is an instance of this class. This class has statistics of a particular file based or block based job.

attribute.name: statisticsInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: volumeRead
attribute.description: Specifies the volume in Kilobytes that has been retrieved from the Message Store.

attribute.name: volumeReported
attribute.description: Specifies the volume in Kilobytes that has been sent to the remote destination.

class.name: CPStatisticsInfo
class.description: Represents the record transfer statistics for a particular CP. For each record transfer job there will be one or more instances of this class.

attribute.name: cPStatisticsInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: recordsLost
attribute.description: Specifies the number of Message Store records declared as lost.

attribute.name: recordsRead
attribute.description: Specifies the number of Message Store records read from Message store.

attribute.name: recordsSkipped
attribute.description: Specifies the number of Message Store records declared as skipped.

class.name: MessageStore
class.description:
Represents a message store that is configured for data record transfer from CP. Message stores are published on APG for receiving the traffic generated by CP(s).
The setting of messageStoreName and recordSize can fail for one of the following reasons: - Connection with message store temporary unavailable, try again : This message appears when the connection with the message store is temporary unavailable. - Record size cannot be changed since the message store contains not acknowledged messages : This message appears when the recordSize attribute is changed when the message store contains not acknowledged messages. - Message store name cannot be changed since the message store contains not acknowledged messages : This message appears when the messageStoreName attribute is changed when the message store contains not acknowledged messages. - The value of recordSize attribute should be smaller than or equal to value of recordlength attribute : This message appears when the value of recordSize attribute is greater than the value of recordlength attribute in MOC FileBasedJob. - The value of recordSize attribute should be smaller than or equal to value of length attribute : This message appears when the value of recordSize attribute is greater than value of length attribute in MOC BlockBasedJob.
Note: A restart of the traffic flow from CP is required if the attributes messageStoreName and recordSize of this class are modified.

attribute.name: messageStoreId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It holds the name of the message store which cannot be modified by the end user. It holds the same name as the messageStoreName attribute's initial value.

attribute.name: numberOfRecords
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of records that can be stored in a file.

attribute.name: numberOfFiles
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in a message store at the same time. When the numberOfFiles reaches threshold an alarm is raised.

attribute.name: alarmLevel
attribute.description: Specifies at what storage level in the message store an alarm is initiated. The value is given in percent of message store. Size of the message store is determined by numberOfRecords * recordSize * numberOfFiles.

attribute.name: messageStoreName
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the message store. The default values to this attribute for the 8 instances of this class are CHS, CHS1, CHS2, CHS3, CHS4, CHS5, CHS6, CHS7 respectively.

attribute.name: recordSize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum size of a record in bytes.

attribute.name: alarmSeverity
attribute.description: Specifies the severity of the alarm that is raised when the message store is filled to alarmLevel.
